snippet: A man who killed a German exchange student trespassing in his garage was convicted of deliberate homicide Wednesday despite arguing that a “castle doctrine” law allowed him to use deadly force.
abstract: Markus Kaarma of Montana, who killed German exchange student Diren Dede after the 17-year-old trespassed in his garage, is convicted of deliberate homicide; he had argued that Montana's 'castle doctrine' law allowed him to use deadly force if he feared for his life.
lead_paragraph: A man who killed a German exchange student trespassing in his garage was convicted of deliberate homicide Wednesday despite arguing that a “castle doctrine” law allowed him to use deadly force.

headline.main: Montana: Man Convicted of Murder for Shooting of Garage Intruder
headline.print_headline: Montana: Man Convicted of Murder for Shooting of Garage Intruder
